etymons.notes: Arb. prpt or frft/ṭ ‘zarpeln, flattern, sich hin und herwerfen’ VW I 59, VW II 94

Preterit.text: bʕīǧ, mayəṯ, mfarfəṭ ʻer erschickte, starb, röchelteʼ; 775;
Naqqa i qaṭәn xila naqqa mfarfṭo ‘As soon as the cat ate, then she sniffled. suddenly died’ 004_NE_Ditin_Hezar; 12:23

Infectum.text: hama ḥzeli: gava kale ko-mifarfəṭ ʻI saw that [the cow] was pantingʼ; 775; 44/111; kul=lalyo (…) šəmʕi-wa qole d-ʕezo oṯe-wa qarén mina qaymi-wa əzzehən-wa ga ʕezo kal-ko-mifarfto ‘Every night (...) they heard the voice of a goat, the moan came from it, they stood up, went (and saw): the goat was in death-agony’ LuF 304/67;

idioms: (Detrans.) röcheln, schnaufen, die Bewegungen eines sterbenden, krepierenden machen, sterben, krepieren;
